name: Paris
title: Greek - Paris
role: Prince of Troy, Abductor of Helen, Slayer of Achilles
summary: Paris, also called Alexander, is the Trojan prince whose abduction of Helen sparked the Trojan War. Son of Priam and Hecuba, he was chosen by Zeus to judge which goddess - Hera, Athena, or Aphrodite - was fairest. He chose Aphrodite, who promised him the most beautiful woman in the world. In Homer's Iliad, he appears as a skilled archer but reluctant warrior, scorned by Hector yet protected by Aphrodite. He ultimately slays Achilles with an arrow guided by Apollo.
description: Paris, prince of Troy and son of Priam, judged the beauty contest between Hera, Athena, and Aphrodite, choosing Aphrodite and winning Helen of Sparta. In Homer's Iliad, he is portrayed as more lover than warrior, skilled with the bow but avoiding close combat. Apollo guides his arrow to slay the invincible Achilles.

homeric_context.role_in_epic: Cause of the war through Helen's abduction; portrayed as more lover than warrior
key_books: Book 3 - Duel with Menelaus, rescued by Aphrodite
Book 6 - Rebuked by Hector for cowardice
character_portrayal: More skilled with bow than in close combat
Rebuked by Hector for starting war then avoiding battle
Portrayed as effeminate by Greek warriors

judgment_of_paris.description: At the wedding of Peleus and Thetis, Eris (Strife) threw a golden apple inscribed 'For the Fairest.' Hera, Athena, and Aphrodite claimed it. Zeus chose Paris, a shepherd on Mount Ida, to judge.
contestants: Hera - offered rule over all lands
Athena - offered wisdom and victory in war
Aphrodite - offered the most beautiful woman in the world
judgment_of_paris.choice: Paris chose Aphrodite, winning Helen but earning the eternal enmity of Hera and Athena
judgment_of_paris.consequences: This judgment led directly to the Trojan War

quests: Judged the divine beauty contest on Mount Ida
Traveled to Sparta and abducted/seduced Helen
Defended Troy throughout the ten-year war
feats: Chosen by Zeus to judge between three goddesses
Won Helen, the most beautiful woman in the world
Slew Achilles, greatest of Greek warriors
weapons: Apollo's guidance in the fatal shot

lovers: Oenone (nymph, his first wife, abandoned for Helen)
divine_allies: Apollo (guided his arrow to slay Achilles)
